page.title: 08THE WARREN
page.content: The Warren is an area of 13 acres to the S. of Toft Hill & just inside the National Park. It is owned by Stockton & Thornaby District Scout Council which bought it in 1977. The building, once a gamekeeper's cottage, is now used as an ablutions block. There is no piped water supply & no electricity. Water is from a spring & is purified. There is a septic tank. The 2 ponds which are surrounded by daffodils have been filled with newts & sticklebacks. The National Parks Committee provided the 1000 or so young trees that the Scouts planted around the site. The site is used by Cubs, Brownies & Scouts from Stokesley & Cubs from Kirby for evening meetings in Summer. It is used by Stockton & Thornaby Venture Scouts, Scouts & Cubs for weekend camps & other activities. The area is grass, gorse & some sedge.
